summary: Interactive romantic-themed Valentine web page (HTML/CSS/JS) to ask Sunidhi to be the user's Valentine, with Yes/No buttons where No evasively moves on hover and Yes reveals a "Good choice❤❤❤" meme image; designed to run on iPad Chrome.
architectural_notes: Implement as a self-contained HTML/CSS/JS page optimized for iPad Chrome.
UI behavior: 'No' button moves away on hover to prevent clicking; 'Yes' triggers display of a meme image with text "Good choice❤❤❤".
Use a pink/white romantic color scheme and simple single-purpose layout.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Meme-style image with bold readable caption text "Good choice❤❤❤", romantic pink/white aesthetic, simple comedic layout (valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1200x800.png)

existing_features.title: Create a single-page romantic Valentine prompt that asks: "Will you be my Valentine, Sunidhi?" and presents exactly two options: "Yes" and "No".

Implement evasive behavior for the "No" button so it cannot be clicked: when the user hovers over or otherwise points at "No", it moves to a new position within the visible viewport, staying fully on-screen and not overlapping the "Yes" button.
When the user clicks/taps "Yes", replace the decision UI with a celebratory view that shows a meme image containing the text "Good choice❤❤❤".
Apply a cohesive romantic visual theme using a pink and white color scheme, with simple, clean layout and responsive sizing optimized for iPad Chrome.

Add the required generated meme image to the frontend as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and render it directly from the frontend (no backend serving or dynamic image generation at runtime).

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a single-purpose interactive Valentine proposal webpage for Sunidhi with evasive 'No' button and 'Yes' click showing a 'Good choice❤❤❤' meme image; pink/white romantic theme; runnable on iPad Chrome.

projectName: Romantic Valentine prompt page with evasive No button and celebratory meme
